result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: See DAGP document for details of agreement

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Caleb E. Rogers

records.addlTxt: Deferred Acceptance of a Guilty Plea Agreement (DAGP) - Signed

ADDRESS INFO for Caleb E. Rogers
Current: 1527 Badger Ave, Eau Claire, WI 54701 United States  (Effective: 08-30-2022)
Prior: 6614 S 50th Ave, Laveen, AZ 85339

(Case called at 10:32 AM)
Defendant Caleb E. Rogers appeared by video with Attorney Jay E. Heit.  Attorney Trenton John Piltz Mr appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
State recites agreement for the Court, which calls for a 24-month Deferred Acceptance of a Guilty Plea agreement (DAGP).  Defendant acknowledges the terms and conditions of the DAGP, as well as the Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form.  Defendant waives personal appearance. Defendant advised of the maximum possible penalties and elements of the offense, as well as his Constitutional Rights.  Defendant pleads Guilty to Count 1: False Imprisonment.  Court accepts the plea, but does not enter it and will hold it open for 2 years in accordance with the DAGP.  Count 2 is dismissed and read in.  Defendant updates address to Badger Avenue in Eau Claire.
DAGP Return Hearing: September 2, 2024 at 9:30 AM
Deferred Acceptance of a Guilty Plea Agreement (DAGP) - Signed by all but ADA Piltz
